message_1:
What is the value of P and Q in the following Relevance Logic statement:

If P implies Q and P is true, then is Q necessarily true?

P = 1
Q = ?
message_2: In relevance logic, if P implies Q and P is true, then Q is necessarily true. Since P is given as true (P = 1), then Q must also be true. Therefore, Q = 1.
